sense.gloss: to go upstream, to go up (a river)
to go back (to the past or origin), to date back (to), to trace back (to), to be retroactive (to)
going to the source, tracing to the origin
going upstream, sailing against the current
anadromous fish (fish that migrates upstream, e.g. salmon)
right of recourse, right for redemption

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑自分↑↓じぶん↓の↑祖先↑↓そせん↓を200↑年↑↓ねん↓↑遡↑↓さかのぼ↓ることができる。
sdata.e: I can trace my ancestors back 200 years.

sdata.j: ↑剣道↑↓けんどう↓は、↑武士↑↓ぶし↓の↑時代↑↓じだい↓に↑遡↑↓さかのぼ↓る↑日本↑↓にっぽん↓↑古来↑↓こらい↓の↑武術↑↓ぶじゅつ↓です。
sdata.e: Kendo is an ancient Japanese martial art that dates back to the time of the samurai warriors.

sdata.j: ↑映画↑↓えいが↓は↑第↑↓だい↓↑二↑↓に↓↑次↑↓じ↓↑世界↑↓せかい↓↑大戦↑↓たいせん↓に↑遡↑↓さかのぼ↓る。
sdata.e: The film takes us back to World War II.

words.gloss: to go upstream, to go up (a river)
going to the source, tracing to the origin
